Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery large bowl or lekane; interior glazed black; exterior, from top: part of incised spoke rosette; pair of narrow bands (fired brown); black-figure animal frieze, preserving a bird (tail feathers remaining) to left and panther (back, hind legs, rump and tail) to right; wide black band with added white and red lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 123, pl. XXXVIII, no. 347.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1314) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6005 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
